intro: Cephalophilon, commonly known as the golden crown fern, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate, lace-like fronds that resemble a crown, giving it its common name. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, Cephalophilon is considered a valuable species in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
